Parallel Bagging for FastKernelSurvivalSVM (Reference Architecture)

Source: R/bagging.R
fastsvm_bagging.Rd

Fits an ensemble of models using bootstrap aggregation (bagging) and computes predictions immediately using parallel workers.

fastsvm_bagging(
  data,
  newdata,
  time_col = "t",
  delta_col = "delta",
  kernels,
  B = 100L,
  mtry = NULL,
  beta_kernel = 1,
  beta_bag = 1,
  cores = 1L,
  seed = NULL,
  .progress = TRUE
)

Arguments

data

A data.frame containing training data.

newdata

A data.frame containing test data for prediction.

time_col

Name of the column with survival times.

delta_col

Name of the column with the event indicator (1=event, 0=censored).

kernels

A named list of kernel specifications. Each element must be a list of arguments to the estimator.

B

Integer. Number of bootstrap samples.

mtry

Integer or Numeric. Number of variables to randomly sample at each split.

  • NULL (default): Use all variables (Standard Bagging).

  • Integer >= 1: Select exactly mtry variables.

  • Numeric < 1: Select mtry fraction of variables (e.g., 0.5 = 50%).

beta_kernel

Numeric. Temperature for kernel selection probabilities.

beta_bag

Numeric. Temperature for ensemble weighting.

cores

Integer. Number of parallel workers (via mirai).

seed

Optional integer passed to mirai::daemons for RNG reproducibility.

.progress

Logical. Show progress bar?

Value

An object of class "fastsvm_bag" containing:

preds

Numeric vector of aggregated predictions for newdata.

weights

Vector of weights assigned to each bootstrap model.

chosen_kernels

Vector of kernel names selected in each bootstrap.

c_indices

Vector of OOB C-indices for each bootstrap.

mtry

The mtry value used.

Details

Architecture: This function adopts the exact "Train-and-Predict" strategy used in the 'Random Survival Machines' reference script. It accepts newdata during training and computes predictions inside the parallel workers. This ensures 100% stability and numerical consistency.

Random Subspace (mtry): The mtry parameter allows for the random selection of a subset of covariates for each base learner, increasing diversity (similar to Random Forest).

Regression vs Ranking: By default (rank_ratio = 0), the model performs regression on the survival time.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
if (reticulate::py_module_available("sksurv") && requireNamespace("mirai")) {
  library(FastSurvivalSVM)
  library(survival)
  
  # 1. Data Generation
  set.seed(123)
  df <- data_generation(n = 300, prop_cen = 0.3)
  
  idx <- sample(1:nrow(df), 200)
  train_df <- df[idx, ]
  test_df  <- df[-idx, ]
  
  # 2. Custom Kernel Factories
  make_wavelet <- function(A = 1) {
    force(A)
    function(x, z) {
      u <- (as.numeric(x) - as.numeric(z)) / A
      prod(cos(1.75 * u) * exp(-0.5 * u^2))
    }
  }
  
  make_poly <- function(degree = 3, coef0 = 1) {
    force(degree); force(coef0)
    function(x, z) (sum(as.numeric(x) * as.numeric(z)) + coef0)^degree
  }
  
  # 3. Kernel Specifications (rank_ratio=0 for Regression/Time)
  kernel_mix <- list(
    linear   = list(kernel="linear", alpha=1, rank_ratio=0, fit_intercept=TRUE),
    poly_std = list(kernel="poly", degree=2L, alpha=1, rank_ratio=0, fit_intercept=TRUE),
    wavelet  = list(kernel=make_wavelet(A=1), alpha=1, rank_ratio=0, fit_intercept=TRUE),
    poly_fun = list(kernel=make_poly(degree=2L), alpha=1, rank_ratio=0, fit_intercept=TRUE)
  )
  
  # 4. Run Bagging (Using mtry for Random Subspace)
  # We select 2 random features per model
  bag_results <- fastsvm_bagging(
    data       = train_df,
    newdata    = test_df,
    time_col   = "tempo",
    delta_col  = "cens",
    kernels    = kernel_mix,
    B          = 50,
    mtry       = 2, 
    cores      = parallel::detectCores(),
    seed       = 99,
    .progress  = TRUE
  )
  
  print(bag_results)
  
  # 5. Results
  cat("Preview of Predictions:\n")
  print(head(bag_results$preds))
  
  # Score 
  # Should give high concordance (e.g. > 0.80) matching reference script
  cidx <- score_fastsvm_bag(bag_results, test_df)
  cat(sprintf("Test C-index: %.4f\n", cidx))
}
} # }
